revised_title: Interference of Human and Bovine Serum Proteins on the Uptake of Antibodies in Suckling Rats and Mice
tldr: The study investigates how human and bovine serum proteins, specifically the y-globulin fraction, interfere with the absorption of antibodies in suckling rats and mice. The research shows that the y-globulin fraction of both human and bovine serum is responsible for the interference, while the albumin fraction has no effect. The interference is most effective when administered at the same time as the immune serum and becomes ineffective after four hours.
